Todd Jonker wrote:
>It's clear that jUnit isn't complete support for XP-ish functional testing. 
>That requires something that can track pass rates over time, make sure 
>previously-passing tests don't start failing, maybe print some reports for 
>the Customer to review... 
>So what tools are people using to support functional testing? 

Keith's comment was a direct hit for me too.

I evaluated a commercial tool but found it to be limited in a couple of 
important areas - the tool was able to interact with JUnit test cases so 
we decided that using JUnit would preserve the option of using the 
commercial tool at a later stage.  Having made that decision I am now 
enhancing JUnit to provide additional functionality to make it more 
suitable for the task at hand.  This includes:

- filtering the junit methods from the stack trace output.
- causing the stack trace to be output for all assertion failures and fails.
- making the test cases continue after an assertion failure or fail (the 
skeleton code for this was provided by jpulley (Thanks Jerry) - see: 
https://sourceforge.net/forum/forum.php?thread_id=64361&forum_id=48543)

The last thing on my list of things to implement (the others are done) 
is to store the test results in a database to allow the tracking of pass 
rates over time.  I haven't given too much thought to how I might do 
this yet but I would imagine it would be an extension to TestRunner.
I am not sure I will get to this just yet as other priorities are on the rise.

I confess to little knowledge of XP - just what you come across in 
the JUnit documentation.

Scott
